prompt: <description>**Part 1: A rectangular metal plate with a central circular hole.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5719, 0.0] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following extrusion parameters: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.5156 - sketch_scale: 0.75 - operation: Join with the existing body. Sketch On the X-Y plane of the coordinate system, draw a rectangle with two vertical lines and two horizontal lines. * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.6, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.6, 0.0], End Point [0.6, 0.6] * Line 3: Start Point [0.6, 0.6], End Point [0.0, 0.21] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.21], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0.75 units in the positive Z-direction to create the three-dimensional shape. Scale the sketch by 0.6 prior to extrusion. Part 2: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and 180.0 and a translation vector of 0.12, 0.6, and 0.0. Sketch On the X-Y plane of the coordinate system, draw a rectangle with two vertical lines and two horizontal lines. * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.6], End Point [0.105, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.105, 0.0], End Point [0.405, 0.0] * Line 3: Start Point [0.405, 0.0], End Point [0.51, 0.6] * Line 4: Start Point [0.51, 0.6], End Point [0.0, 0.6] Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0.6 units in the negative Z-direction to create the three-dimensional shape. Scale the sketch by 0.6 prior to extrusion and join the extrusion with the preceding CAD models. The resulting shape will be a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Final shape: A three-dimensional geometric shape with a combination of rectangular and triangular forms. The shape has a flat base and a tapered top, with a single, angled cutout on the side. The two parts combine to form the final shape, with the first part creating the base and lower portion, and the second part creating the top portion with a tapered shape.</description>
